column4: yes i install from usb to HDD and when it passes grub it loads for a few secs then throws me some errorrs about the kernel
what errors ?
if you just use the installer cd and install to usbhd, maybe even disconnect internal drives won't work ?
please put in nick, if talking to me, else I loose your message; why should hd be screwed ?
no need for pm, just start line with nick (without '!'), see:
well i dont know do you have any suggestions?
why do you think hd is broken ?

because it was given to me if i could fix it cuz wincrap wouldnt load...so i tried xp, vista and 7 and none could write in the HDD, then i isntelled linux and it worked so i thought i could give him dual boot. when i was running gparted light went out and the laptop turned off eventually without completing and since then my problems sttarted
I see, do you have a live cd handy and the drive around ?
yes i have a live cd with no errors...scanned in 2 differents laptos
: attach the usb-hd then and boot into live, call the messenger there and come back here
im currently running another install from usb...75% atm
still a port free for the other usb ?
im installing into the laptop's HDD from 1 usb yeah and i have 2 more usb ports available to use
so attach the 'broken' drive...
:S the one i think is broken is the HDD of the laptop not the usb-hd...
the one youi're on now ?
nop i have it just right here with me but its not this one
so you want a fix for a not available drive ?

it is available, it installs completely and confirms and everything, reboots and when i change to boot from HDD in the laptop it starts giving me ugly messages about the kernel trying to kill the unit

if you set the lap to boot first from cd, then fro hd, don't have to change bios, just remove cd (and disablecd if you want), so it should work; else without checks these request becomes too speculative, you should access the system it's going about and then connect to here again
install suddendly stoped
ill be back later i have to go
thanks
